result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A. Muehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay financial obligations for Ct 1 directly to Clerk of Courts. Court waives financial obligations for Ct 2.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for controlled substance upon request of DOC or law enforcement designee.  
Defendant shall not to possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.

Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and document with DOC monthly.
Defendant shall document interview efforts with DOC.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ashley A. Muehl in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kyle Robert Reimann in court for Ashley A. Muehl. Per agreement, State will amend Ct 1 to 943.15(1). Defendant will plead to Cts 1 and 2. State recommends 2 years probation with the following conditions: 1 set of court costs, DNA, work full time or seek 3 applications a week and document with DOC monthly, 90 days jail with work release, and to submit to random drug testing. Court grants amendment to Ct 1. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Michelle Gerl heard. Attorney Reimann heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: pay costs on Ct 1, cost on Ct 2 waived, submit DNA sample, not to possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, to maintain full time employment, if not employed full time seek 3 applications a week and document monthly with DOC, document interview efforts with DOC, to submit to testing for controlled substance upon request from DOC or law enforcement designee. If revoked, 45 days credit.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
